Is Fizz toxic?

Yes, but it is not just Fizz that is the problem.

The entire assassin class (more specifically the subcategory of safe assassins) is designed to tilt people, be toxic, and feel unfair to play against.

I main support specifically so that I have the most power in the game to make assassin players suffer.

Some assassins have well defined weaknesses, but they are few and far between.
{{champion:55}} has a horrid early game, and is easily shut down if she can't get a kill early into a teamfight.
{{champion:38}} has the worst early game out of all champions, and needs several items to be relavent.
{{champion:29}} is a fucking marksman with the playstyle of an assassin. He is almost completley immobile, is squishy as hell, and can do nearly nothing to stop people from getting on top of him.
{{champion:60}} has low scalings, so pretty much has to build MPEN tank. She is heavily reliant on her cocoon, which is not that hard to dodge. Rappel does not exactly provide godlike mobility. 
{{champion:28}} if she does not snowball, she has NO chance.  Her passive is powerful, and with enough items she can succeed, but if she gets put behind she will be useless for the rest of the game. Oh, and pink wards. Those exist.

Then we have champions who actually see play.

His ult has quite a bit of counter play. O.o If anything, it is one of the most generous ults in the game. It is relatively slow, the hitbox isn't even that big but is a bit bigger than the visual. BV/QSS/Mercurial hard counter it by completely negating it, so does flash, any dash/blink, Zhongya or any other stasis. Backing off hard as you can means he can't use his E for damage in most cases which is a core part of his damage early/mid game, and still a good chunk late game, as he needs it to close the gap unless there is a mob/player he can Q to get close enough and even with the ult's knock up might not be enough.

Hex drinker/Maw/GA/Zhonga/anything that counters his burst and gives Mres+HP or a Mres+Shield make it hard for him to kill, especially if there is mobility with the champ. Personally, I think Fizz is one of the most appropriately tuned champions in the game when going AP, tho some issues can be seen when going bruiser. Having a good amount of range + AoE for clearing waves also causes issues for Fizz and prevents him from engaging, generally even forcing him to waste his little bit of mana on clearing the minion wave and not being able to roam due to this. Raw HP, in general, is very strong against Fizz especially before late game or he gets pretty fed since he will usually not have the AP to support Lich and skills and CD reduction to do much after his initial burst.
